title: Azure Data Lake Storage
text:
Source: Data Integration

Azure Data Lake Storage
Azure Data Lake Storage is a comprehensive, scalable, and cost-effective data lake solution for big data analytics built into Azure.



Azure Data Lake Storage


Use Azure Data Lake when you need:

a data repository on the cloud for managing large volumes of data.
to manage a diverse collection of data types such as JSON files, CSV, log files or other diverse formats.
real-time data ingestion and storage.

title: Compare Azure Data Lake to Azure Blob Storage
text:
Source: Data Integration

Compare Azure Data Lake to Azure Blob Storage








Criteria
Azure Data Lake
Azure Blob Storage




Data type
Good for storing large volumes of text data.
Good for storing unstructured non-text-based data such as photos, videos, backup etc.


Namespace support
Supports hierarchical namespaces.
Supports flat namespaces.


Hadoop compatibility
Hadoop services can use data stored in Data Lake.
Is not Hadoop compatible.


Security
Access Control Lists (ACLs), shared keys, SAS, and RBAC.
Shared keys, SAS, and RBAC.

title: Data-Driven Workflows
text:
Source: Data Integration

Data-Driven Workflows
Azure Data Factory is a cloud-based ETL and data integration service that can help you create and schedule data-driven workflows (called pipelines) that ingest data from disaparate data stores.



Data-Driven Workflows


You can use Azure Data Factory to:

Orchestrate data movement.
Transform data at scale.
